alert.note: Alert for Beaver; Cimarron; Texas (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 5:27AM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...LIGHT SNOW AHEAD FOR THE PANHANDLES... An upper level winter system is expected to track from southeastern Utah Tuesday afternoon to across the southern Texas Panhandle Wednesday. Light snow is expected to develop across the Oklahoma Panhandle late Tuesday afternoon. The light snow will then shift south to the remainder of the Panhandles Tuesday evening into Wednesday morning, with some snow potentially hanging on into the early afternoon in the southeastern Texas Panhandle. Some light snowfall accumulation, perhaps one to two inches, will be possible across the far western and extreme northeastern Oklahoma Panhandle with another band of around 1 to 3 inches of accumulation across the southwestern Texas Panhandle. The snow may reduce the visibility at times and may cause snow- packed and icy roads. The snow may impact the Wednesday morning commute. Stay tuned to the developments of this winter system by visiting our homepage at www.weather.gov/ama/.
